Well, by luck our mailman screwed up and gave us someone else's copy of Psychology Today. They had an article that showed that the ratio of the index finger to the "ring finger" could possibly be an indicator for sexual orientation.
 
 In women, generally, the index finger is longer than the ring finger or the same length and in men the ring finger is pretty much always longer than the index finger. It has to do with what hormones were firing during fetal development, or some such.
 
 Here are some links about finger length:
 
 http://cms.psychologytoday.com/articles/pto-20050614-000004.html
 
 http://www.yawningbread.org/apdx_2000/imp-075.htm
 
 http://flatrock.org.nz/topics/odds_and_oddities/finger_length_ratios.htm
 
 http://my.webmd.com/content/article/101/106273.htm
 
 http://www.bath.ac.uk/pr/releases/fingerlength.htm
 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 
 
 So this is probably old hat to some of you.
 
 I'd like to do a little survey here, though, if that's all right.
 
 Could you please state your sexual orientation and a brief description of your finger length ratios?
 
 I am heterosexual and when I hold my hand out flat my ring finger is about 5mm longer than my index finger.

 "ya....big kleenex..."
Bisexual, and my ring finger is about 1-2mm longer than my index finger.
